project.name: |-- 002-generics-wildcard
project.description:
Keywords: + Generics + The wildcard ? character
This project includes some very simple examples involving the wildcard character.
AllowedTypeTests: Demonstrates how to use the wildcard character when using generics. The ? character lets you declare a method that accept any parameterized type.
BoundedWildcardTest: Demonstrates how to bound the wildcard character so that the method can only accepts a given class, or any class that extends from it. In the example it is created a getAverage() method that works for any class that inherits from Number.
The classes includes simple runners that can be executed as java programs.
